faqs.question: What is the current average price range for a newly built house in Sector 21C
faqs.answer: The price range in Sector 21C is highly variable depending on the plot size, construction age, and whether it is an independent house or a builder floor. Generally, a modern 4 Marla builder floor might start from INR 80 Lakhs, while a larger 8 Marla independent house can easily range from INR 2 Crore to INR 35 Crore or more. faqs.answer: Absolutely. faqs.question: What are the typical property ownership costs besides the house price
faqs.answer: Beyond the sale price, buyers must account for several mandatory expenses. These typically include Stamp Duty and Registration Charges, which in Haryana usually amount to about 7% for men and 5% for women buyers. You also need to factor in legal fees, brokerage fees if applicable, and costs associated with property verification and title search. If you are taking a home loan, processing fees and interest rates will also be applicable. We provide a detailed breakdown of all associated closing costs upfront so there are no surprises during the final stages of your purchase.

faqs.question: Are there any specific building bylaws or restrictions in Sector 21C
faqs.answer: Yes, all construction in Sector 21C must comply with the Haryana Urban Development Authority HUDA and Municipal Corporation Faridabad MCF bylaws. Key restrictions relate to floor area ratio FAR, ground coverage, maximum allowed height, and mandatory setbacks from the plot boundaries. Most residential plots permit stilt plus four floors. It is crucial to ensure any house you buy has an occupation certificate OC and the construction matches the sanctioned building plan to avoid future penalties or demolition notices. Our team verifies these documents rigorously before listing.

faqs.question: How is the water and electricity supply infrastructure in the sector
faqs.answer: Sector 21C benefits from well-established civic utilities due to its maturity. The water supply is generally reliable, managed by the relevant local authority. Electricity supply is also stable, often through the Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam DHBVN. While power cuts are rare, many independent houses have provision for power backup or solar installations. Utility connections are streamlined and efficient, which is a major benefit compared to newer sectors still developing their infrastructure.

faqs.question: Can Non-Resident Indians NRI purchase property in Sector 21C

NRIs can buy property using funds received via inward remittance through normal banking channels or funds held in NRE Non-Resident External or NRO Non-Resident Ordinary accounts in India.
